header_summary: Johan Torås Halseth suggests using OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY to manage funds between online and offline users. Steven Roose discusses the concept of a TxHash and introduces a BIP for selecting specific data within a transaction. Gijs van Dam expresses interest in decorrelated payments. ZmnSCPxj discusses the implementation of a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism and explains its purpose.

recent_posts.title: Solving CoinPool high-interactivity issue with cut-through update of Taproot leaves
recent_posts.summary:
- Johan suggests that OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY may achieve what Antoine is looking for.
- By committing public keys and balances in dynamic data, pooled balances can be achieved.
- Offline users' funds remain inaccessible until they come online; Eltoo can handle double spending.

recent_posts.title: MATT: [demo] Optimistic execution of arbitrary programs
recent_posts.summary:
- Johan agrees with aj's correction that it should be O(log n) for the program.
- Johan explains that P doesn't matter as they break the program into n steps.
- Participants agree on the trace length upfront to ensure consistency and rejection of non-balanced trees.

recent_posts.title: Draft BIP: OP_TXHASH and OP_CHECKTXHASHVERIFY
recent_posts.summary:
- Steven has worked on a BIP for the concept of TxHash and seeking feedback.
- The BIP introduces TxFieldSelector for selecting data in a transaction with various fields.
- Steven discusses achievements, open questions, and seeks wider feedback and community interest.

recent_posts.title: Payment Splitting & Switching and its impact on Balance Discovery Attacks (preprint)
recent_posts.summary:

recent_posts.title: Sidepools For Improving Payment Reliability At Scale
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj discusses implementing a sidepool using the Decker-Wattenhofer mechanism, highlighting several numbers to consider.
- These numbers include the number of stages, steps per stage, and blocks per step.
- The purpose of the sidepools mechanism is to balance channels through swap parties and updates.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions"
active_posts.summary:
- Storage for blockchain is sufficient, with manageable expenses and potential for optimization.
- A 5TB hard drive costing less than $150 provides storage that lasts 21 years.
- Ongoing optimization efforts reduce the amount of space needed by individual nodes.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email discusses the challenge of scaling Lightning channels for casual users.
- It suggests using covenants and timeout-trees to eliminate the need for multiple signatures.
- By incorporating these mechanisms, Lightning can improve scalability and become widely used.

active_posts.title: Concrete MATT opcodes
active_posts.summary:
- Salvatore Ingala has presented a complete proposal for the core opcodes of MATT.
- The proposal includes functional improvements, such as replacing OP_CHECK{IN, OUT}CONTRACTVERIFY with a single opcode, OP_CHECKCONTRACTVERIFY (CCV).
- The new opcode checks if input/output's scriptPubKey is a P2TR and introduces additional parameters for flexibility.

active_posts.title: Scaling Lightning With Simple Covenants
active_posts.summary:
- The email proposes solutions to scale Lightning in a trust-free manner with simple covenants.
- Enabling simple covenants would allow millions of casual users to create Lightning channels.
- Timeout-trees can be used for long-term scaling, providing off-chain accessibility for casual users.

active_posts.title: Remotely control your lightning node from your favorite HSM
active_posts.summary:
- Bastien has submitted a pull request to the bLIPs repository [1] proposing a secure way to send administrative commands to a lightning node using an HSM as a whitelisted peer.
- The architecture involves minimal changes to the lightning node and utilizes a standard lightning connection and custom lightning messages.
- Bastien is willing to provide specifications, review implementation, and suggests exploring open-source grant possibilities.

active_posts.title: Practical PTLCs, a little more concretely
active_posts.summary:
- Greg discusses the importance of PTLCs and shares a detailed analysis on GitHub.
- He examines factors like single-sig adaptors, async updates, and message re-ordering in PTLCs.
- Greg suggests that his information can lead to discussions and invites feedback.
